H0.text: An exothermic process is a change that releases heat when matter undergoes chemical reactions or physical changes.

H1.text: Magnetic process is a change that releases heat when matter undergoes chemical reactions and physical changes.

H2.text: An oxidized process is a change that releases heat in matter undergoing chemical reactions and physical changes.

H3.text: Biochemical process is a change that releases heat when matter undergoes chemical reactions or physical changes.

A4.text: An exothermic reaction is a 'reaction for which the overall standard enthalpy change ΔH° is negative.'

A5.text: Aerobic respiration captures the released energy for the formation of ATP.

A6.text: An exothermic reaction occurs when heat is released to the surroundings.

A7.text: Examples of exothermic processes are: Combustion of fuels such as wood, coal and oil/petroleum.
